intro: Codariocalyx microphyllus f. glaber, commonly known as the smooth-leaved codariocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, smooth leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
